003 * image processing published by Springer-Verlag in various languages and editions.

006 * Copyright (c) 2006-2022 Wilhelm Burger, Mark J. Burge. 
007 * All rights reserved. Visit https://imagingbook.com for additional details.
008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.filter.generic;
010
011import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
012import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
013
014/**
015 * This (abstract) class represents a generic scalar filter whose
016 * pixel-operation is x/y-separable. It is similar to
017 * {@link GenericFilterScalar} but requires two methods to be implemented by
018 * concrete sub-classes: {@code doPixelX(PixelSlice, int, int)} and
019 * {@code doPixelY(PixelSlice, int, int)} for the x- and y-pass, respectively,
020 * which are invoked in exactly this order. If the processed image has more than
021 * one component (e.g., a RGB color image), this filter is automatically and
022 * independently applied to all (scalar-valued) components. The remaining filter
023 * mechanics including multiple components, out-of-bounds coordinate handling,
024 * multiple passes and data copying are handled by this class and its
025 * super-class (see {@link GenericFilter}).
026 */
027public abstract class GenericFilterScalarSeparable extends GenericFilter {
028        
029        protected boolean doX = true;   // allow implementing sub-classes to deactivate x/y pass
030        protected boolean doY = true;
031        
032        // for progress reporting only
033        private int slice;
034        private int sliceMax = 1;
035        
036        private int iter = 0;
037        private int iterMax = 1;        // for progress reporting only
038        
039        
040        // apply filter to a stack of pixel planes (1 pass)
041        @Override
042        protected void runPass(PixelPack source, PixelPack target) {
043                sliceMax = source.getDepth();
044                for (int k = 0; k < sliceMax; k++) {
045                        //IJ.log("+++++++ starting slice " + k);
046                        this.slice = k;
047                        runSlice(source.getSlice(k), target.getSlice(k));       // default behavior: apply filter to each plane, place results in target
048                }
049        }
050        
051        // a bit wasteful, as we provide a separate target for each plane
052        private void runSlice(PixelSlice source, PixelSlice target) {
053                final int width = source.getWidth();
054                final int height = source.getHeight();
055                this.iterMax = width * height * 2;
056                this.iter = 0;
057                
058                if (doX) {
059                        // IJ.log("doing X-part =============================== ");
060                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
061                                for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
062                                        target.setVal(u, v, doPixelX(source, u, v));
063                                        this.iter++;
064                                }
065                        }
066                        target.copyTo(source);
067                }
068                
069                if (doY) {
070                        // IJ.log("doing Y-part =============================== ");
071                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
072                                for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
073                                        target.setVal(u, v, doPixelY(source, u, v));
074                                        this.iter++;
075                                }
076                        }
077                }
078                
079                this.iter = 0;
080        }
081        
082        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
083
084        /**
085         * Applies a 1D filter operation in x-direction.
086         * This method must be implemented by concrete sub-classes.
087         * This method is invoked before {@link #doPixelY(PixelSlice, int, int)}.
088         * The source data are passed as a {@link PixelSlice} container, which
089         * holds the scalar values of one image component.
090         * The method {@link PixelSlice#getVal(int, int)} should be used to read
091         * individual pixel values. These data should not be modified but
092         * the (float) result of the single-pixel calculation must be returned.
093         * 
094         * @param source the scalar-valued data for a single image component
095         * @param u the current x-position
096         * @param v the current y-position
097         * @return the result of the filter calculation for this pixel
098         */
099        protected abstract float doPixelX(PixelSlice source, int u, int v);
100
101        /**
102         * Applies a 1D filter operation in y-direction.
103         * This method must be implemented by concrete sub-classes.
104         * This method is invoked after {@link #doPixelX(PixelSlice, int, int)}.
105         * The source data are passed as a {@link PixelSlice} container, which
106         * holds the scalar values of one image component.
107         * The method {@link PixelSlice#getVal(int, int)} should be used to read
108         * individual pixel values. These data should not be modified but
109         * the (float) result of the single-pixel calculation must be returned.
110         * 
111         * @param source the scalar-valued data for a single image component
112         * @param u the current x-position
113         * @param v the current y-position
114         * @return the result of the filter calculation for this pixel
115         */
116        protected abstract float doPixelY(PixelSlice source, int u, int v);
117        
118        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
119        
120        @Override
121        protected final double reportProgress(double subProgress) {
122                double loopProgress = (this.iter + subProgress) / this.iterMax;
123                //IJ.log("   loopProgress = " + loopProgress);
124                double sliceProgress = (this.slice + loopProgress) / this.sliceMax;
125                //IJ.log("   sliceProgress = " + sliceProgress);
126                //System.out.println("reportProgress: GenericFilterScalar " + localProgress);
127                return super.reportProgress(sliceProgress);
128        }
129
130        
131}
